channel.title: Hmmm... Restart any Java based server using batch?
channel.description:
I was thinking of a way to keep my Java based server (Not a RuneScape server, calm down) online or an auto restarter, and I came up with this:
[code]@echo off :pinger cls ping IPOFSERVER if errorlevel==0 goto pinger if errorlevel==1 goto restart :restart cls tskill java.exe run JavaServer.bat sleep.exe 10 goto pinger [/code]
The only problem is I don't know how to ping a specific port in DOS, but I think ip:port would work. Would this work? Or is there a different way to ping a port in batch?

item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

Fasga:

Honestly, most servers shouldn’t be crashing at all in the first place.

True, but what about DoSers and DDoSers?
If the server was written in Java it should be programmed actually to fight back, not allowing many connections and checking on it every so 100 ms.
So, I agree with Fasga.
Oh, and btw Fasga, I was intrigued at your ByteCode Library along with pplsuqballz’s.
